prompt: \small On the left, we depict the lower half of the Euclidean geometry combined with the subsequent Lorentzian evolution. The former %of the Euclidean geometry is used to generate the deformed thermofield initial state. The right figure illustrates the full Euclidean evolution which may be used to compute the normalization factor $Z$ or the thermal expectation value (vev) of operators with an appropriate insertion of operator $O(t)$.
